fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: By ”veto”, we mean either a partial veto (concerning any parts of a bill) or package vetoes (concerning whole bills) of bills that have already been passed by the legislature. The question refers to whether the head of government is considered to hold this power in practice, regardless of whether this is regulated by law and whether this power has been exercised or not.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: If the head of government took actions to veto a piece of legislation, would he/she be likely to succeed?

fxInfo_responses.value: Yes, but the legislature can override the veto by a simple majority vote (a vote of more than half of those voting).
Yes, but the legislature can override the veto by an absolute majority vote (a vote of more than half of the members of the legislature).
Yes, but the legislature can override the veto by a qualified/extraordinary majority vote (a super-majority — e.g., 2/3 or 3/4 — of those voting).
Yes, with no possibility of override.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2exdfvthg, *_osp, *_ord
